title.narrative: OUTP 7.4: DATA AND EVIDENCE GENERATION

description.narrative: Output 7.4: Increased national capacity to generate and utilize data and knowledge on key human rights and gender equality dimensions of social inclusion., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 7: Improved policy environment and systems for disadvantaged and excluded children, guided by improved knowledge and data.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF PUBLIC SERVICE LABOUR AND SOCIAL WELFARE

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 7.4: Increased national capacity to generate and utilize data and knowledge on key human rights and gender equalitydimensions of social inclusion.

description.narrative: The findings from the third round ofhigh-frequency monthly telephone survey of households to measure the socio-economic impacts of COVID-19 in Zimbabwe, supported by UNICEF, World Bank and Zimbabwe national statistics office (ZIMSTAT) influence advocacy and policy decision on the allocation of the USD 958 million International Monetary Fund Special Drawing Rights Allocation to Zimbabwe. The second Zimbabwe National Multiple Overlapping Deprivation Analysis (N-MODA) was finalized to offer better understanding of child deprivation and poverty and inform policy action. The pilot of thegender norms and mental health module for adolescents ahead of MICS 7 was initiated. | Status:Met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
